H0.text: They are different substances when it is determined that the particles in one solid are arranged in a repeating pattern and the particles in another solid are arranged randomly.

H1.text: They have the same weight if it is determined that the particles in one solid are arranged in a repeating pattern and the particles in another solid are arranged randomly.

H2.text: They have the same densities because one solid’s particles are arranged in a repeating pattern while the other’s are arranged randomly.

H3.text: They are different mixtures because one solid’s particles are arranged in a repeating pattern while the other’s are arranged randomly.

A4.text: Amorphous materials cannot be described by the repetition of a finite unit cell.

A5.text: The low bulk density and high void ratios are mostly due to glass shards and other porous minerals not becoming compacted.
